business.headline: GST Council delays decision on lowering tax for health, life insurance premiumsGST Council Meeting: During the 55th meeting held on Saturday, technical considerations led to the deferral, with the Group of Ministers (GoM) tasked to conduct further deliberations.

GST Council Meeting: Will tax rates on health and life insurance premiums drop today? GST Council Meeting begins: One of the key items on the agenda is the proposal to reduce the Goods and Services Tax (GST) on insurance premiums, a move that could bring relief to policyholders.

55th GST Council Meeting begins: What could become costlier or cheaper todayGST Council Meeting: From essential services to luxury items, a wide range of proposals are under discussion, some of which could significantly impact consumers and businesses.

Explained: Why Sensex fell 4,000 points in 5 trading sessionsThe BSE Sensex plummeted over 4,000 points across five consecutive sessions, while the NSE Nifty50 fell approximately 1,200 points, representing a nearly 5% loss within the week.

Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme: FAQs for settling tax disputes easily Taxpayers can resolve pending income tax disputes under the Direct Tax Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024 by settling the disputed tax amount and avoiding additional interest and penalties.

Nita Ambani to headline India Conference at HarvardThe India Conference at Harvard, one of the largest student-led India-focused events in the US, is hosted by students across Harvard's graduate and undergraduate schools.

Sensex nosedives 1,100 points, Nifty falls below 23,600; IT stocks tumbleStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 1,176.46 points lower at 78,041.59, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 364.20 points lower at 23,587.50.
Paytm Money launches 'Pay Later' Margin Trading. 3 things to knowPaytm Money launches 'Pay Later' MTF, democratising stock trading with seamless activation, innovative tools, and affordable rates.

Sensex tumbles 1,000 points. What's behind the bloodbath on Dalal Street?Stock market today: The Sensex had fallen 1033.99 points to 78,184.06 at 3:00 pm, while the Nifty50 slipped 299.35 points to trade at 23,652.35. All broader market indices were also trading in negative territory.

Looking for high returns on investments? Check these 5 optionsBalancing risk and reward is essential for wealth creation. From equities to IPOs and P2P lending, explore these high-return investment options to align with your financial goals and risk appetite.

NACDAC Infra IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusThe Ghaziabad-based construction company's IPO, open from December 17 to December 19, offered shares in the price range of Rs 33-35 per share with a lot size of 4,000 shares.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Check latest GMP, price band and should you apply?Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: The Ahmedabad-based pharmaceutical company is offering shares in a price range of Rs 372-391, with a minimum application size of 38 equity shares and multiples thereafter.
Zerodha launches Margin Trading Facility: What it is and how it worksZerodha's Nithin Kamath introduces Margin Trading Facility, enabling investors to leverage funds for stock delivery.

Ventive Hospitality IPO opens: Check latest GMP, price band, and other detailsVentive Hospitality IPO: The subscription window closes on December 24, 2024. The basis of allotment is expected to be finalised by December 26, with shares credited to demat accounts by December 27.
Sensex, Nifty extend losses amid weak global cuesAt 10:28 am, the S&P BSE Sensex fell 274.86 points to 78,943.19, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 67.90 points to 23,883.80.
Rupee hits all-time low against US dollar. Why is it under pressure?The rupee surpassed its previous low of 85.0850 reached on Thursday and settled at 85.10 by 10:00 am.

Can you get a personal loan with low credit score? Check detailsWhile a low credit score may present challenges, using strategies like reduced DTI, and showing income stability, etc. can help secure a personal loan and improve your credit for the future.
Tata Consumer dismisses reports of Starbucks exiting India as baselessAn earlier report claimed that Starbucks was considering exiting the Indian market due to high costs and mounting losses.
Sensex ends nearly 1,000 points lower, Nifty below 24,000The Sensex ended 964.15 points lower at 79,218.05, while the Nifty50 settled 247.15 points lower at 23,951.70.

Missed ITR deadline? Here's your guide to filing belated return for AY 2024-25The last date to file a belated or revised ITR for FY 2023-24 is December 31, 2024—ensure all dues and penalties are paid to avoid additional charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: ED gets Lt Governor's sanction to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal: SourcesThe development comes weeks ahead of the crucial Delhi Assembly elections, where the AAP is aiming to secure a fourth term. Arvind Kejriwal was granted interim bail in the ED case.

Arrest warrant issued against Robin Uthappa for alleged Provident Fund fraudAn arrest warrant has been issued against former Indian cricketer Robin Uthappa over allegations of Provident Fund (PF) fraud. Shadakshari Gopal, the PF Regional Commissioner, issued the warrant.

Who's driving the car: JD Vance's viral tweet over vague headline on Germany attackThe Associated Press's headline, 'A car has driven into a group of people at a Christmas market in Germany', drew backlash from social media users for using vague headlines in cases where the suspect was already identified and arrested.

Arvind Kejriwal's scholarship scheme for Dalit students amid Ambedkar rowAAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said he launched the Dr Ambedkar Samman Scholarship scheme in response to what he described as Union Home Minister Amit Shah's "disrespectful" statement on the Dalit icon in Parliament.

Who'll put the mandir genie back in the bottle?RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's call for harmony, amidst rising petitions to ascertain the character of mosques and mazars, raises a valid question: where does it stop? While the Places of Worship Act, 1991, prevents changes to their character, it does not stop efforts to assert them. How do we then reconcile with the past and move on?

Ex-Muslim, doctor, pro-far right: Many shades of man behind Germany attackTaleb A, a 50-year-old Saudi doctor arrested for the car attack on Christmas revellers at a market in Germany's Magdeburg, got asylum in the European nation in 2006.

PM in Kuwait for 2-day visit, to meet Emir and address 'Hala Modi' eventDuring his two-day visit to Kuwait, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will hold talks with the Kuwaiti leadership, attend a football tournament, visit a labour camp and address an Indian community event there.

Union Minister vs Shashi Tharoor on dinner party with Soros: Recollections differUnion Minister Hardeep Singh Puri and Congress MP Shashi Tharoor sparred over the list of invitees for a 2009 dinner, where controversial US billionaire George Soros was among the attendees.

Video: Moment when German market attack suspect was arrested at gun pointA car ploughed into a busy outdoor Christmas market in the eastern German city of Magdeburg on Friday, killing at least two people and injuring at least 60 others in what authorities called a deliberate attack. The driver was arrested at the scene shortly after the car barreled into the market at around 7 pm when it was teeming with holiday shoppers looking forward to the weekend. A video shared by the news agency AP showed a German Police officer pointing a gun at the suspect and pinning him down to the ground.

Elon Musk slams Germany for not extraditing 'attacker': Deserves to be punishedElon Musk condemned Germany's refusal to extradite a Saudi suspect, calling it "insane." His support for far-right AfD sparked criticism amidst rising political tensions.

Aussie media stirs controversyThe Australian media has stirred up another controversy just days after Virat Kohli requested an Australian reporter not to take pictures of his family at Melbourne airport, with the press now accusing spinner Ravindra Jadeja of refusing to answer questions in English.

Mumbai tragedy: How mariner saved 56 people using boat that had capacity for 12Captain Anmol Shrivastava, a ship pilot with the Jawaharlal Nehru Port Authority, reached the accident spot within minutes, saving 56 people using his boat that had a capacity of just 12.

Mumbai ferry crash: Parents tried to throw children into sea, stopped by rescuersCISF personnel, including Constable Amol Savant, were the first to respond to a sinking tourist ferry off Mumbai on December 18. They rescued over 50 passengers, including children, and administered life-saving aid.

You think OCD is just about cleanliness? You got it wrong all this longFor Millennials and Gen Z, "OCD" might seem like a trendy buzzword for an obsession with cleanliness. But hold on—there's so much more to it than meets the eye.

Kerala High Court says no to Sunburn festival in landslide-hit WayanadThe Kerala High Court cancelled the Sunburn music festival in Wayanad, scheduled for New Year's Eve, citing illegal construction and safety risks. Concerns were raised about the venue's legality and its proximity to a landslide-prone area.

In-laws put chilli powder, hot rod in woman's private parts in Madhya PradeshThe survivor was subjected to two hours of brutal torture by her husband and in-laws, including physical abuse, burning with a hot iron rod, and the application of chilli powder to her private parts.

Pickleball can make it to Olympics: India's top talents relish sport's boomVrushali Thakare and Vanshik Kapadia, India's top pickleball players, believe that the sport's popularity will only grow with time, citing its inclusivity across all age groups, and back it to make it to the Olympics sooner than expected.

sports.headline: Shreyas Iyer rattles Karnataka with 50-ball century, 10 sixesVijay Hazare Trophy 2024-25: Shreyas Iyer scored 114 runs off 55 balls for Mumbai in their match against Karnataka on December 21 at the Narendra Modi Stadium B Ground in Ahmedabad.

WWE legend Rey Meysterio loses uncle weeks after father's passingThe wrestling world mourned the loss of Rey Mysterio Sr., the Mexican lucha libre icon, who passed away at 66. A mentor and champion, he shaped a family legacy while leaving an indelible mark on the sport.

Guardiola reveals potential verdict time for Manchester City's 115 chargesPep Guardiola hinted that the verdict on Manchester City's 115 alleged breaches of Premier League regulations could arrive between February and March 2025, intensifying speculation over potential consequences for the reigning champions.

Jadeja explains how missing the first two BGT Tests helped him in GabbaRavindra Jadeja credited his exclusion from the first two Tests of this BGT, for sharpening his preparation, as the all-rounder delivered a crucial batting performance at the Gabba. His 77-run innings stabilised India despite his failure to get a wicket in the match.

Ravindra Jadeja confident India can complete BGT hat-trick in AustraliaIndia spinner Ravindra Jadeja is confident of India's chances of completing a hat-trick of Test series victories in Australia after the Gabba Test ended in a draw.

Nathan McSweeney 'devastated' as Boxing Day Test dream shatteredAustralia's Nathan McSweeney was dropped for the Boxing Day Test after just three matches in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, prompting mixed reactions. The young batter expressed disappointment but vowed to work hard for a return to the Test mix in the future.

I got to know Ashwin was retiring 5 minutes before he announced it: JadejaBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Ravindra Jadeja revealed that R Ashwin did not give him the slightest hint about his retirement, even though the two shared adjacent seats in the Indian dressing room at the Gabba on the final day of the third Test.

Will miss 'mentor' R Ashwin, but we need to move on: Ravindra JadejaIndia spinner Ravindra Jadeja reckons he will miss R Ashwin, saying that the retired spinner was an on-field mentor for him. Ashwin and Jadeja took 587 wickets in 58 Tests together.

Heinrich Klaasen fined for outburst during South Africa vs Pakistan 2nd ODIHeinrich Klaasen was fined 15% of his match fee and also received one demerit point for breaching the ICC code of conduct during the South Africa vs Pakistan 2nd ODI.

SA vs PAK: South Africa pacer to miss 3rd ODI due to knee injurySouth Africa have been rocked by injury ahead of the third ODI against Pakistan in Johannesburg as their fast bowler Ottniel Baartman has been ruled out of the last game.

Arjun Erigaisi makes visa plea to US Embassy ahead of World Rapid ChampionshipIndian Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi seeks urgent visa assistance from the US Embassy ahead of the World Rapid and Blitz Championship in New York, highlighting the significance of the event for his qualification to the prestigious Candidates Tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
